name: RunVisualStudioTestsusingTestAgent
friendlyName: Run Visual Studio Tests using Test Agent
description: Run tests distributedly using multiple test agents in a lab machine group.
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: environment
inputs.label: Test Machine Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Test Machine Group on which tests need to be run.

inputs.name: dropLocation
inputs.label: Test Drop Location
inputs.helpMarkDown: The location where the test binaries have been dropped in the agent machine(s) as part of the 'Copy files to Machines' task. System Environment Variables can also be used in location string. e.g., '%systemdrive%\Tests', '%temp%\DropLocation' etc.

inputs.name: sourcefilters
inputs.label: Test Assembly
inputs.helpMarkDown: Test binaries to run tests on. Wildcards can be used. For example, '**\*test*.dll;' for all dlls containing 'test' in their name.

inputs.name: runSettingsFile
inputs.label: Run Settings File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to runsettings file to use with the tests. Use $(agent.BuildDirectory)\$(system.teamProject) to access the Project folder.

inputs.name: codeCoverageEnabled
inputs.label: Code Coverage Enabled
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether code coverage needs to be enabled.

inputs.name: overrideRunParams
inputs.label: Override TestRun Parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: Override parameters defined in the TestRunParameters section of runsettings file. For example: Platform=$(platform);Port=8080

inputs.name: testConfigurations
inputs.label: Test Configurations
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optionally associate a testcase filter against a testconfiguration id. Syntax: <Filter1>:<Id1>;DefaultTestConfiguration:<Id3>. For example: FullyQualifiedName~Chrome:12.
